Package org.onehippo.forge.templating.support.core.servlet

Class AbstractHstTemplateServlet

java.lang.Object
jakarta.servlet.GenericServlet
jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServlet
org.onehippo.forge.templating.support.core.servlet.AbstractHstTemplateServlet
All Implemented Interfaces:
jakarta.servlet.Servlet, jakarta.servlet.ServletConfig, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
HandlebarsHstTemplateServlet, ThymeleafHstTemplateServlet
public abstract class AbstractHstTemplateServlet extends jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServlet
Base Abstract Templating Support Servlet class which can be extended by a specific servlet implementation for a different template technology to substitute for the default HstFreeMarker used in Hippo CMS Delivery tier web application.

This base abstract servlet exists to support the following:

  • To define the methods that must or should be implemented by subclass implementations. e.g, initializeTemplateEngine(ServletConfig) to give the subclass a chance to initialize its own templating engine on initialization phase, getTemplatePath(HttpServletRequest) to give the subclass an easy and safe way to retrieve the dispatched template path, createTemplateContext(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) to give the subclass a chance to construct a Context object to be evaluated by the specific templating engine, and processTemplate(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse, String, Object) to let the subclass finally to process the request with the created Context object on the template path.
  • To define the common string constants such as "webfile:", "classpath", etc.
  • To provide a generic JCR Observation event listener mechanism to invalidate the template cache on any template configurations and webfiles changes, so subclasses do not have to worry about implementing the JCR observation event listener by itself as long as it is okay to invalidate every cache item on any change, which is almost not a problem in production where you don't update those configurations and webfiles at runtime, and which is still very beneficial during development phase locally.
See Also:

    • createTemplateContext

      protected abstract Object createTemplateContext(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws jakarta.servlet.ServletException, IOException
      Create a templating engine specific Context object which can be evaluated by the template.

      This method is invoked by process(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse) method before invoking processTemplate(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse, String, Object) to pass a Context object to the processTemplate(HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse, String, Object).

      Parameters:
      request - HttpServletRequest instance
      response - HttpServletResponse instance
      Returns:
      a Context object which can be evaluated by the template
      Throws:
      jakarta.servlet.ServletException - if servlet exception occurs
      IOException - if IO exception occurs

    • processTemplate

      protected abstract void processTemplate(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response, String templatePath, Object context) throws jakarta.servlet.ServletException, IOException
      Resolve the template by the templatePath and process the template for the request with the templating engine specific context object.
      Parameters:
      request - HttpServletRequest instance
      response - HttpServletResponse instance
      templatePath - template path
      context - Templating engine specific Context object which is evaluated by the template
      Throws:
      jakarta.servlet.ServletException - if servlet exception occurs
      IOException - if IO exception occurs

    • clearTemplateCache

      protected void clearTemplateCache()
      Clear the template cache if available in the subclass. It does nothing by default unless overridden.
